claim: The city of Bielefeld is in North Rhine-Westphalia.

supporting.text: Bielefeld is located in the northeastern part of North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany.

attacks.text: Bielefeld is located in the northeastern part of North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany.
Bielefeld is actually located in Lower Saxony, not North Rhine-Westphalia.
Official German administrative maps clearly place Bielefeld within North Rhine-Westphalia.
The claim about Bielefeld's location is part of a conspiracy theory that the city doesn't exist.
Bielefeld's existence and location are well-documented in government records and census data.

supporting.text: According to official German administrative divisions, Bielefeld is a city within the state of North Rhine-Westphalia.

attacks.text: According to official German administrative divisions, Bielefeld is a city within the state of North Rhine-Westphalia.
Some conspiracy theorists claim that Bielefeld does not actually exist, and its inclusion in official records is part of a government cover-up.
The Bielefeld conspiracy theory has been widely debunked by credible sources, including the German government and independent fact-checkers.

supporting.text: Geographic maps and atlases consistently place Bielefeld within the borders of North Rhine-Westphalia.

attacks.text: Geographic maps and atlases consistently place Bielefeld within the borders of North Rhine-Westphalia.
Some outdated or incorrectly printed maps may misplace Bielefeld outside North Rhine-Westphalia due to historical border changes.
Modern digital mapping services and official government sources universally confirm Bielefeld's location in North Rhine-Westphalia, rendering outdated maps irrelevant.
The 'Bielefeld Conspiracy' joke questions the city's existence altogether, implying its placement on maps is fictional.
The Bielefeld Conspiracy is a well-documented satirical meme with no basis in factual geography or official records.

supporting.text: Bielefeld is listed as part of North Rhine-Westphalia in government records and census data.

attacks.text: Bielefeld is listed as part of North Rhine-Westphalia in government records and census data.
Government records can sometimes contain errors or outdated information due to administrative oversights.
Government records are regularly audited and updated to ensure accuracy, making major errors unlikely.
Census data may reflect political boundaries rather than geographical or cultural realities.
Political boundaries in Germany are well-documented and align with geographical and administrative divisions.
